Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
Some things i need to find out is if i can have prompt support in a build system (unlikely) like `Type your message: ` and that can be passed into.   But because makefiles wouldn't normally be used in this way, it's a stupid use case for it.
For stuff like starting daemons it is useful.  update one makefile, tell ppl to pull it and run `make staked5` and it connects to the staked5 network without having to put -ac_name=STAKED5 -addnode=xx.xx.xx.xx -ac_reward=YYY etc.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its already there

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you just add a password to the end of the kvupdate command

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this way once you use a key once (which I made the username) its proected by a password, so noone can impersonate you.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: trick is to get on chain as fast as you can and just use your wanted name.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then its yours for the life of the chain, or you forget the password you used.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I also made a bunch of other changes that made the chat chain actaully viable, displaying messages faster from mempool, is a wanted extra to keep up the good work
